messages.content:
Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

Equally various were the answers to the second question.
Some said that the members of the king's council were the most important people, while others mentioned priests, doctors, or warriors.
In response to the third question, some replied that science was the most important thing, whereas others insisted that it was war or religious worship.
The king was not pleased with any of the answers.
Still wishing to find the best answers to his questions, the king decided to visit an old hermit who was famous for his wisdom.
The hermit lived in a forest and met only ordinary folk, so the king disguised himself as a simple peasant.
He ordered his bodyguards to stay behind while he went on alone to seek out the hermit.
Reaching the hermit's hut, the king found the old man digging in his garden.
The hermit greeted the king and continued digging.
The king said, "I have come here to ask you three questions. How can I learn the right time to do everything? Whom do I most need to pay attention to? Finally, what is the most important thing to do?"

Equally various / were the answers / to the second question.
똑같이 다양했다 / 대답들은 / 두 번째 질문에 대한
Some / said / that the members / of the king's council / were the most important people, / while / others / mentioned / priests, / doctors, / or / warriors.
몇몇은 / 말했다 / 멤버들이 / 왕의 자문위원회의 / 가장 중요한 사람들이라고 / 반면 / 다른 사람들은 / 언급했다 / 성직자들 / 의사들 / 또는 / 기사들이라고
In response to the third question, / some / replied / that science / was the most important thing, / whereas / others / insisted / that it / was war or religious worship.
세 번째 질문에 대한 답으로 / 몇몇은 / 답변했다 / 과학은 / 가장 중요한 것이라고 / 반면에 / 다른 사람들은 / 주장했다 / 그것은 / 전쟁 또는 종교적인 예배라고 
The king / was not pleased / with any of the answers.
왕은 / 기쁘지 않았다 / 어떤 대답에도
Still / wishing to find / the best answers / to his questions, / the king / decided / to visit an old hermit / who was famous / for his wisdom.
여전히 / 찾기를 원했기 때문에 / 가장 최고의 답변을 / 그의 질문에 / 왕은 / 결심했다 /  늙은 은자를 방문하기로 / 유명한 / 그의 지혜로
The hermit / lived / in a forest / and / met / only ordinary folk, / so / the king / disguised / himself / as a simple peasant.
그 은자는 / 살았다 / 숲에서 / 그리고 / 만났다 / 오직 / 평민들만 / 그래서 / 왕은 / 변장했다 / 그 스스로를 / 평범한 농부로
He / ordered / his bodyguards / to stay behind / while he / went on / alone / to seek out the hermit.
그는 / 명령했다 / 그의 경호원들에게 / 뒤에 남아있기를 / 그가 / 가는 동안 / 혼자 / 은자를 찾기 위해서
Reaching the hermit's hut, / the king / found / the old man / digging / in his garden.
은자의 오두막에 도착했을 때 / 왕은 / 발견했다 / 노인을 / 땅을 파고 있는 / 그의 정원에서
The hermit / greeted / the king / and / continued / digging.
은자는 / 인사를 했다 / 왕에게 / 그리고 / 계속했다 / 땅 파는 것을
The king / said, / "I / have come here / to ask you / three questions. / How can I / learn / the right time / to do everything? / Whom do I / most need to pay attention to? / Finally, / what is the most important thing / to do?“
왕은 / 말했다 / 나는 / 이곳에 왔다 / 당신에게 물어보기 위해 / 세 가지 질문을 / 어떻게 내가 / 배울 수 있을까요? / 적절한 시간을 / 모든 것을 할 / 누구에게 내가 / 가장 관심을 기울일 필요가 있을까요? / 마지막으로 / 가장 중요한 것은 무엇인가요? / 해야 할

Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

To this day, the Brooklyn Bridge stands as evidence of the Roebling family's persistence.
These amazing people made incredible sacrifices and overcame all obstacles to complete a project that seemed impossible to others.
Not only did they prove their doubters wrong, but they also achieved an accomplishment that inspired us to do the impossible.

To this day, the Brooklyn Bridge stands as evidence of the Roebling family's persistence.
지금까지도 / 브루클린 다리는 / 서 있다 / 증거로 / Roebling 가문의 끈기의 
These amazing people made incredible sacrifices and overcame all obstacles to complete a project that seemed impossible to others.
이러한 놀라운 사람들은 / 해냈다 / 엄청난 희생을 / 그리고 / 극복했다 / 모든 장애물들을 / 프로젝트를 완수하기 위해 / 불가능한 것처럼 보이는 / 다른 사람들에게
Not only did they / prove / their doubters wrong, / but they / also achieved / an accomplishment / that inspired / us / to do the impossible.
그들이 / 증명했을 뿐만 아니라 / 그들의 의심하는 사람들이 / 틀렸다는 걸 / 그들은 / 또한 이뤘다 / 업적을 / 고무하는 / 우리가 / 불가능한 일을 하도록

Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

One of the best things that travel gives us is the memories of the places we've visited and the special experiences we had there. 
In order to hold on to these precious memories, we often bring home souvenirs. 
These souvenirs tend to be objects like postcards, fridge magnets, and key chains. 
However, a souvenir doesn't have to be something purchased in a gift shop. 
In fact, the word souvenir means "memory" in French, so whatever brings back memories could be called a "souvenir." 
Then what can we keep as souvenirs to preserve our travel memories other than ordinary gift shop products? 
Let's look into what other travelers do to make their travel memories last longer.

One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we've visited / and / the special experiences / we had there. 
최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던 In order to hold on to these precious memories, / we / often bring / home / souvenirs. 
이런 소중한 추억들을 간직하기 위해 / 우리는 / 종종 가져온다 / 집에 / 기념품들을 
These souvenirs / tend to be objects / like postcards, fridge magnets, and key chains. 
이러한 기념품들은 / 물건이 되는 경향이 있다 / 엽서, 냉장고 자석, 그리고 열쇠고리와 같은 
However, / a souvenir / doesn't have to be something / purchased in a gift shop. 
그러나 / 기념품은 / 무언가가 될 필요는 없다 / 기념품샵에서 구입된 
In fact, / the word souvenir / means / "memory" / in French, / so / whatever brings back memories / could be called / a "souvenir." 사실 / 기념품이라는 단어는 / 의미한다 / “기억”을 / 프랑스어로 / 그래서 / 기억을 떠올리게 하는 것은 무엇이든지 / 불릴 수 있다 / “souvenir”(기념품) 이라고 
Then / what can we keep / as souvenirs / to preserve our travel memories / other than ordinary gift shop products? 
그렇다면 / 우리는 무엇을 간직할 수 있을까 / 기념품으로서 / 우리의 여행 기억을 간직할 / 평범한 선물가게 제품들 외에 
Let's look into / what other travelers do / to make / their travel memories / last longer. 
살펴보자 / 무엇을 다른 여행자들이 하는지 / 만들기 위해 / 그들의 여행 기억들이 / 더 길게 유지되도록

Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

On the Internet, Minjeong sees an advertisement that reads, “100% of users report brighter and softer skin with Blossom Company's liquid facial soap.” 
It claims that these results are from an independent laboratory and are guaranteed by a public agency. 
Minjeong does not question the statistics and buys some bottles, despite the high price. 
However, although Minjeong uses the soap for a few months, she does not experience any noticeable changes. 
Did Minjeong just happen to buy a defective product? Or was the advertisement completely fake? 
When Minjeong read “100% of users,” she should have asked herself, “Where did the company get this figure?” 
If Minjeong had read the tiny letters at the bottom of the ad, she would have found that the sample included only five people.
As in this case, when a sample is not large enough to show a wide range of results, it can be misleading. 
By using small samples, companies can come up with any results they want and use them for their own purposes.

On the Internet, / Minjeong / sees / an advertisement / that reads, / “100% of users / report / brighter and softer / skin / with Blossom Company's liquid facial soap.” 
인터넷에서, / 민정이는 / 본다 / 광고를 / 쓰여있는, / 100%의 사용자들이 / 보고한다고 / 더 밝고 부드러운 / 피부를 / Blossom사의 액상 세안 비누로
It / claims / that these results / are from an independent laboratory / and / are guaranteed / by a public agency. 
그것은 / 주장한다 / 이러한 연구 결과가 / 독자적인 연구소로부터 나왔다고 / 그리고 / 보장받는다고 / 공공 기관에 의해
Minjeong / does not question / the statistics / and / buys / some bottles, / despite the high price. 
민정이는 / 의문을 갖지 않는다 / 통계에 대해 / 그리고 / 구매했다 / 몇 병을 / 높은 가격에도 불구하고
However, / although Minjeong / uses / the soap / for a few months, / she / does not experience / any noticeable changes. 
하지만, / 민정이가 / 사용함에도 불구하고, / 그 비누를 / 몇 달 동안 / 그녀는 / 경험하지 못한다 / 어떠한 눈에 띄는 변화도
Did Minjeong / just happen to buy / a defective product? / Or / was / the advertisement / completely / fake? 
민정이가 / 그저 우연히 구매한 것일까 / 결함이 있는 제품을 / 혹은 / 그 광고가 / 완전히 / 거짓이었을까
When Minjeong / read / “100% of users,” / she / should have asked / herself, / “Where / did the company get / this figure?” 
민정이가 / 읽었을 때 / ‘100%의 사용자들’을 / 그녀는 / 물었어야만 했다 / 스스로에게 / 어디에서 / 회사가 얻었을까 / 그 수치를
If Minjeong / had read / the tiny letters / at the bottom of the ad, / she / would have found / that the sample / included / only five people.
만약 민정이가 / 읽었었더라면 / 작은 글자를 / 광고 하단의 / 그녀는 / 알았을 것이다 / 그 표본이 / 포함했음을 / 오직 다섯 명의 사람들을
As in this case, / when a sample / is not large enough / to show / a wide range of results, / it / can be misleading. 
이 경우에서처럼, / 표본이 / 충분히 크지 않다면, / 보여줄 만큼 / 다양한 결과를 / 그것은 / 오해를 불러일으킬 수있다.
By using small samples, / companies / can come up with / any results / they want / and / use them / for their own purposes.
적은 표본만을 사용함으로써, / 회사들은 / 내놓을 수 있다 / 어떤 결과든지 / 그들이 원하는 / 그리고 / 이용할 수 있다 / 그것들을 / 그들의 목적을 위해

Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

"For the last time, I beg you to answer my questions," the king said.
"They've already been answered," said the hermit.
"What do you mean?" the king asked.
"If you hadn't helped me, you would've left, and that man would've attacked you.
Therefore, the most important time was when you were digging.
I was the most important person, and helping me was the most important thing.
Later, the most important time was when you cared for the man.
If you hadn't helped him, he would've died, so he was the most important person, and helping him was the most important thing.
Remember, there is only one time that is important: now!
The person that you are with is the most important person, and doing that person good is the most important thing."

"For the last time, / I / beg / you / to answer my questions," / the king / said.
마지막으로 / 나는 / 간청드립니다 / 당신에게 / 내 질문에 답해주기를 / 왕이 / 말했다
"They /'ve already been answered," / said the hermit.
그것들은 / 이미 대답이 되었다 / 은자가 말했다
"What do you mean?" / the king / asked.
무슨 의미입니까? / 왕이 / 물었다
"If you / hadn't helped / me, / you / would've left, / and / that man / would've attacked / you.
만약 당신이 / 돕지 않았더라면 / 나를 / 당신은 / 떠났을 것이다 / 그리고 / 그 남자가 / 공격했을 것이다 / 당신을
Therefore, / the most important time / was when you / were digging.
그러므로 / 가장 중요한 시간은 / 당신이 / 땅을 파고 있을 때이다
I / was the most important person, / and / helping me / was the most important thing.
나는 / 가장 중요한 사람이었다 / 그리고 / 나를 도와주는 것은 / 가장 중요한 일이었다
Later, / the most important time / was when you / cared / for the man.
이후에 / 가장 중요한 시간은 / 당신이 / 돌봐줬을 때이다 / 그 남자를
If you / hadn't helped / him, / he / would've died, / so / he / was the most important person, / and / helping him / was the most important thing.
만약 / 당신이 / 돕지 않았었더라면 / 그를 / 그는 / 죽었을 것이다 / 그래서 / 그는 / 가장 중요한 사람이고 / 그리고 / 그를 돕는 것은 / 가장 중요한 것이다
Remember, / there is only one time / that is important: / now!
기억하세요 / 오직 한 순간이 있다 / 가장 중요한 / 바로 지금이다
The person / that you are with / is the most important person, / and / doing that person good / is the most important thing.“
사람은 / 당신과 함께하는 / 가장 중요한 사람이다 / 그리고 / 그 사람에게 잘하는 것은 / 가장 중요한 일이다
